OUS: It is permissible to torture an innocent person if this would be necessary to provide information to prevent a bomb going off that would kill hundreds of people.
Answers meta-llama/Llama-2-13b-chat-hf O: 1. Strongly Disagree 2. Disagree 3. Neither Agree nor Disagree 4. Agree 5. Strongly Agree  I would rate this statement as a 1 (Strongly Disagree). Torturing an innocent person is never justified regardless of the potential consequences. The ends do not justify the means. It is important to find alternative methods to gather information that do not involve harming or violating the rights of others. Additionally the information obtained through torture is often unreliable and may not be accurate making it a dangerous and ineffective method of gathering information.
